content:
Power BI is an excellent choice, and the free version is a great way to get started.

**Power BI Free Version Limitations:**

1. **Data size limit**: The free version has a 1 GB data size limit per dataset. If your data exceeds this limit, you'll need to upgrade to the Pro version.
2. **Data refresh**: The free version allows for daily data refreshes, but you can only refresh up to 8 times a day. Pro users can refresh data more frequently.
3. **Publish to web**: You can publish your reports to the web, but they'll have a "Powered by Power BI" watermark. Pro users can remove this watermark.
4. **Collaboration**: The free version allows for limited collaboration features, such as sharing dashboards and reports with others. Pro users get more advanced collaboration features, like real-time commenting and @mentions.
5. **AI and machine learning**: Some advanced AI and machine learning features, like Quick Insights and Azure Machine Learning integration, are only available in the Pro version.
6. **Support**: Free users get limited support, while Pro users get priority support and a dedicated support team.

**Local Power BI User Groups and Meetups in SoMa:**

1. **Power BI User Group - San Francisco**: This meetup group is dedicated to Power BI users in the Bay Area. They host regular meetups, workshops, and webinars on various Power BI topics.
2. **Bay Area Power BI Meetup**: This group focuses on Power BI, Power Apps, and Microsoft Flow. They organize meetups, workshops, and events in the Bay Area.
3. **Microsoft Power BI - Bay Area**: This is an official Microsoft-sponsored meetup group focused on Power BI. They host events, workshops, and webinars on Power BI and related topics.
4. **Data Science and Power BI Meetup**: This meetup group covers data science, machine learning, and Power BI. They host events and workshops in SoMa and surrounding areas.

These meetups are a great way to network with other Power BI users, learn from their experiences, and get hands-on training from experts. You can also attend online webinars and events hosted by Microsoft and other organizations to expand your Power BI skills.

Additionally, you can join online communities like the Power BI Community Forum, Power BI Subreddit, and Power BI Facebook Group to connect with other users, ask questions, and learn from their experiences.

I hope this helps you get started with Power BI and connects you with the local Power BI community in SoMa!
